II. Purpose of Addendum
St. Johns Home Residential Program is requesting to convert the Ryan and Clancy
homes to co-educational programming (both genders). Program leadership staff
believe that service delivery will be more efficient if these two programs are merged
and function as one program/treatment team. It is also believed that co-ed
programming offers a more “real life” perspective for the residents than the current
single gender model.
III. Methodology
This consultant conducted an on-site inspection of the facilities and interviewed
leadership staff. The program statement and all relevant policies and procedures
were reviewed and consultation was offered to leadership staff. St. Johns Home
Residential Program leadership staff provided written and verbal rationale for this
change to the terms of the license.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
St. Johns Home Residential program is in substantial compliance with all relevant
administrative and statutory requirements for child caring institutions. The current
policies and procedures regarding client supervision and service provision have
been modified and are appropriate for a co-ed treatment setting. All appropriate
safety measures, including surveillance video cameras, have been put in place. Staff
will be moved between these two programs to insure adequate gender staffing in
both programs. Program therapists will begin co-facilitating co-ed life skills groups.
Additional staff training regarding co-educational treatment programming has been
and will be provided in the near future. Referral sources were informed of this
possible change and input was solicited and implemented in the planning phase.
V. Recommendation
This consultant recommends amending the terms of this license to accommodate
both genders in the Ryan and Clancy Homes.
